reviewText: I bought this after trying it out from the library and really liking it. I own five of the Tae-bo advanced workouts--the older ones on VHS that are about 55 minutes long each and kick your ass--and this one is definitely easier, but lots of fun and the workout I'll reach for when I want something not TOO hard but that will make me feel like I did work out that day.  Also when I was in the highly fatigued phase of my pregnancy, I'd do about half of the Favorite Moves just to get my heart rate up for 20 minutes; no way I'd be able to get through any of the others.I think the thing that makes this workout easier is there seems to be a lot less repetition of each move, so it's a nice medium-impact, light sweat cardio workout but none of my muscles get tired like they do with the other Tae-bo videos, and my heart rate doesn't ever get as high.  Most of the most common Tae-bo moves are here with a little less kicking and a couple of dance-type steps.  At the end there's a section on the floor doing butt and abs, then he adds in a couple of things from the Boot Camp workout (btw I didn't like the Boot Camp workouts very much; this is more classic Tae-bo.).  Actually, if you ever did the "original" advanced Tae-bo video--the first advanced one he did--the Favorite Moves reminds me of it a lot, albeit a little shorter and easier.If you are expecting something like those harder advanced Tae-bo tapes, you may not like this one.  But I'd recommend it if those are a bit hard or you want to do Tae-bo on a given day but want to take it a little easier.
summary: Easier Tae-bo workout but one of my favorites too!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Billy Blanks seems to loosen up on his tough edge, although he does add in some fun (via silly dance moves). He doesn't make you perform the usual gazillion sets of moves, but quickly advances you from one exercise to the next. You'll still sweat, but you can't expect to be drenched. Get this DVD if you want to have a little workout fun.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First, I love Billy and his Tae Bo workouts!!  Compared to his other workouts, I feel this one is relatively easy as far as moves go, but also gets your heart pumping.For beginners:  This workout will be difficult at first.  Since it's titled "Favorite Moves" you will have to be familiar with Billy's moves in order to get the full effect of the workout.  If you have never done any of Billy's workout videos before, I would recommend starting with the Tae Bo II Instructional and Get Fit Workouts.  However, with that being said, the moves done in this video are very easy to learn and are actually the easiest (I think) of all Billy's moves.  If you have no background doing Tae Bo, just go at a slower pace (Billy does not give much instruction on how to do the moves in this video) and you will catch on quickly.  Once you get the hang of the moves, you will find this workout pretty challenging if you are just starting to work out.  It is pretty high intensity and Billy does not take time to rest, (or march) like he does in most of his workouts.  However, if you stick with it, you will definitely see results!  One thing I do not like about this video is there is no warm-up period, ie. stretching, however, he does take time at the end to cool down and stretch.For intermediate to advanced users:  You will find this workout easy as far as moves are concerned but it is still pretty intense.  It keeps your heart pumping, and as I said, Billy goes from one move to the other very quickly, with little time to rest, which I enjoy.  It's definitely not the hardest workout of his (in my opinion, that honor goes to Tae Bo II Advanced Get Ripped) but does make you feel like you got a good workout.  I also like this workout because Billy does focus on individual body parts, like stomach and legs (saddle bag area).  Overall, I give this workout 4 out of 5 stars.  Definitely not the hardest Billy's ever done, but a good workout nonetheless.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my favorite Billy Blanks workout.  My roommate and I purchased it because we wanted to try something different.  The moves were a little challenging the first time through, but we caught on quickly. It is one of our favorite videos now.  You can tell everyone in the DVD is having fun and we have a great time doing it too.  This DVD is good for everyone, but beginners should expect a challenge.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Admittedly I bought this because it is meant to be intermediate but I still found it a bit of a challenge.  It's a great workout for those used to his intensity, and while I'm fairly fit, it was alright for me, but if you are a beginner, think before purchasing this.All up, it's about 45 minutes long and some will find it hard to get through.  You start with punches and kicks but from there it gets progressivly harder.  Everyone in the class is overly super smiley and having way too much fun.  I guess that's not a bad thing, but not always are you that happy while working out.  This is really his favourite kind of workout because he's more enthusiastic than usual.  It is a good workout for the fit - you'll need to do it a couple of times a week along with other routines, but it's good and challenging and quite enjoyable.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this Billy Blanks DVD and it is so fun and amazing. I have added it to my exercise collection, and it fits perfectly. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a fun workout that makes you sweat like crazy. This is a total body workout. Also, I want to add that this is not one of those Favorites DVD that are just small segments from different DVDs. This is a full dvd workout that plays all the way through, no 10 minute segments to chose from. I also must say that the music in this is very upbeat, keeps you pumped and fits the workout perfectly.I would HIGHLY recommend this workout.
Title: N/A
